info.comment: The angle of rotation in degrees
The angle at which the target is tilted
The part to be eluted from the reagent
The part to be extracted from the reagent1
The portion of the reagent1 that needs to be precipitated
The final concentration of the reagent to be added, if applicable
The container where the item will be collected
The container where the reagent will be dispensed
Container to collect the filtered reagent
The container where the pooling will take place
The container to hold the reagent1
The type of well or plate to be used for seeding
The container where reagent1 needs to be inoculated,a INOCULATE instruction must has one of "reagent2" or "container"
The container to collect sorted cells(usually tube)
Container to place the divided parts into
The container to setup, e.g., PCR tube, Eppendorf tube, PCR plate, glass plates, hotplate, perfusion station, culture dishes, manipulation dish
The container where the reagent is packed
The value to adjust the attribute to
The data to be analyzed, a ANALYZE instruction can either has "reagent1" or "data1", but cannot have neither or both
The target to be read(usually file)
The density of cells to be plated per cm^2 or per well
The desired cell density if dropping cell suspension
The destination where the sample is being transferred
The destination where the volume is pipetted to
The location where the reagent1 is to be placed
The location where the reagent is to be loaded
The destination of the drawn reagent, if applicable
The destination where the object will be split into
The target where the reagent is dropped
Where the recovered sample is placed
The device used to remove the item
The method used for this operation
The device used for flow(At least provide one of "device" or "reagent2")
The device used to dispense the reagent
Device used to cut the object
The device to be used for spinning, default=centrifuge
Device used for cell counting, such as 'Countess Machine', 'hemocytometer', etc.
The device to be turned on or off
The device used to separate the objects
The device in which the cells or organism are grown
The device used to weigh the reagent1, default=electric balance
Device used for sealing if any
Device or equipment used for assembly
The storage condition for the saved sample
The device or material to pass the reagent through
The device used to draw the reagent, such as a syringe or pipette
The device used for sorting, default=FACS
Products after connecting device1 and device2
The device used to pull the object
The device or software used to acquire the data
The first device to be connected
The second device to be connected
The object to fit into object1
Direction in which the object is cut, including preposition
The direction in which the object is pulled
The condition under which the item is collected
Operating environment, such as N2 or water bath
Any specific environment under which the object is cut
Operating environment, such as vacuum or nitrogen
Environment under which the procedure is performed
The condition under which the data was collected
The condition under which the separation is performed
Additional growth conditions, such as CO2 concentration or shaking speed
The conditions under which the seeded cells are to be incubated
The condition to be met before proceeding
The physical environment under which reagent1 is cooled, such as "ice bath" or "in the dark"
The condition under which the object should be split
The environment under which reagent is observed
Any equipment used during the transfer
The equipment used to check the item
The rate at which the reagent is flowed
The format in which the sample/data is to be saved
The format to export the data in
The intensity at which to centrifuge the sample, usually represented as rpm/xg/rcf
The intensity at which the spin should be performed, default=appropriate intensity
The intensity at which to centrifuge the sample, usually represented as rpm/xg/rcf
The location where the dissection is performed
The method used to remove the item
The method used to collect the item
The method of mixing, such as inversion, vortexing, pipetting, etc.
The method used to purify the reagent
Method used for elution, e.g., centrifugation, boiling, shaking
Method of precipitation, e.g., shaking, spinning, etc.
The method used to check the item
The method used to load the reagent
Method used for counting cells, such as 'hemocytometer', 'cell counter', 'Trypan Blue method', etc.
The method used to adjust, if applicable
The method used to separate the objects
The method or kit used to generate the target
The method of administration of the anesthetic
The method used for transfection, default=standard procedures
Method used to divide the object
The method used to assess the sample
Specific method or protocol for induction
The method or tool used for alignment
The method used to sacrifice the animal
The method used to read, such as command line, setting, etc.
The method or tool used to trim the object
The mode to be switched to
Sequencing mode, e.g. single-end or paired-end
Additional parameters for reading, such as wavelength, channel, etc.
The position where the object is attached
The position to which the object is pulled
The position in which the object should be held
when "device"=PCR machine(thermocycler), this parameter should be changed to REQ
PCR program to be used for amplification
when device=Covaris Adaptive focused ultrasonicator, this parameter should be changed to REQ
The program used for sorting data
Standard transformation protocols to be followed
The purpose for saving the sample
The purpose of importing the file
The quantity of reagent or data to be acquired
Number of parts to divide the object into
The ratio of reagents to be added, if applicable
The ratio of reagents to be mixed
The ratio for splitting the object
Products after connecting reagent1 and reagent2
The primary reagent to which other reagents are added
The type of cells to be plated
The main reagent to be mixed
The source from which the volume is pipetted
The main reagent to be prepared
The reagent to be spun down
The reagent to be taken out or used
reagent to be counted(usually cell), keep alive
The reagent from which "component" is to be separated, keep alive
The cells or organism to be grown
The reagent to be weighed, keep alive
The type of cells to be seeded
The main component to be assembled
The column or device to be equilibrated
The reagent or object to be cleaned
The reagent to be passed through
The reagent to be sorted(usually cells)
The reagent to be transfected(usually cells)
The reagent or subject to be induced
The first item to be compared
The main reagent to be setup
Additional reagents to be added to the primary reagent
The medium or buffer in which the reagent is suspended
The item to replace with, defult = another brand new reagent
Additional reagents to be aspirated if any
The material used to rinse the object,defult = water
The fixative to be used, or The place to fix the reagent1
Additional reagents used during the run, such as supporting medium
Stain used for cell counting, if applicable
The material used to seal the container
The medium in which cells are to be seeded
Additional components to be assembled with the main component
The reagent(usually solution) used for blocking
Additional reagents used for staining(usually staining agent)
The material used to cover the object
The buffer or solution used for equilibration
The reagent where reagent1 needs to be inoculated(usually medium)
Additional reagents used in the amplification process
The object to which the first object is attached
Additional reagents used during the process
The buffer to be used during sorting
The reagent into which transformation is to be done
The plasmid to be transfected into the cells
Medium in which the object is picked
The other reagent used to wipe
The substrate on which the material is deposited
The second item to be compared
The object to which object1 is aligned, keep alive
The material used to wrap the item
The recipient(usually mouse) of the reagent
The other reagent(s) to be added
The other reagent used for passaging
The other reagent used for transfection(usually transfectant)
Number of times the object should be rinsed, default=1
The number of times the pipetting action is repeated
Number of times the procedure is repeated
Number of times the process is repeated
The settings used on the device
Any specific settings or conditions for the acquisition
Size of the sections to be cut
The size to which the object should be trimmed
The software used for calculation if any
The software where the file will be imported
The source from where the sample is being transferred
The location from where the reagent is to be taken out
The state to which the device should be turned, either 'on' or 'off'
The state needs to be ensured
The final concentration of the diluted reagent
The temperature at which the spin should be performed, default=room temperature
The timing to stop waiting, a WAIT instruction must has one of "time" or "termination"
The duration for which to centrifuge the sample
The duration for which the spin should be performed, default=appropriate time
The time to wait, if specified
When the reconstitution should be done, if applicable
The volume of the reagent to be dispensed (Volume per serving)
The volume of the sample to be saved
The volume of the reagent to be drawn
The volume of each split part
The volume of the reagent to be dropped
